movies.title: Amour fou
movies.plot: Berlin, the Romantic Era. Young poet Heinrich wishes to conquer the inevitability of death through love, yet is unable to convince his skeptical cousin Marie to join him in a suicide pact. It is whilst coming to terms with this refusal, ineffably distressed by his cousin's insensitivity to the depth of his feelings, that Heinrich meets Henriette, the wife of a business acquaintance. Heinrich's subsequent offer to the beguiling young woman at first holds scant appeal, that is until Henriette discovers she is suffering from a terminal illness
movies.simplePlot: Berlin, the Romantic Era. Young poet Heinrich wishes to conquer the inevitability of death through love, yet is unable to convince his skeptical cousin Marie to join him in a suicide pact. ...

biography.bio: Christian Friedel was born on March 9, 1979 in Magdeburg, Saxony-Anhalt, Germany. He is an actor, known for The White Ribbon (2009), 13 Minutes (2015) and Amour fou (2014).
biography.name: Christian Friedel

biography.bio: Birte Schnoeink is an actress, known for Amour fou (2014), Lore (2012) and Remembrance (2011).
biography.name: Birte Schnoeink

biography.bio: Stephan Grossmann was born on September 2, 1971 in Dresden, East Germany. He is an actor, known for Amour fou (2014), Refuge (2015) and Hilda & Karl (2006).
biography.name: Stephan Grossmann

biography.bio: Sandra Hüller was born in 1978 in Suhl, East Germany. She is an actress, known for Toni Erdmann (2016), Requiem (2006) and L'amour et rien d'autre (2011).
biography.name: Sandra Hüller

biography.bio: Holger Handtke was born in 1968 in Berlin, Germany. He is an actor, known for The Monuments Men (2014), Enemy at the Gates (2001) and Hart's War (2002).
biography.name: Holger Handtke

biography.bio: Barbara Schnitzler was born on February 19, 1953 in East Berlin, East Germany. She is an actress, known for Amour fou (2014), Une Fenêtre sur l'été (2011) and Ein verdammt schöner Tag (1976). She is married to Michael Knof. They have two children.
biography.name: Barbara Schnitzler

biography.bio: Alissa Wilms was born in 1995. She is an actress, known for The Reader (2008), Amour fou (2014) and Of Girls and Horses (2014).
biography.name: Alissa Wilms

biography.bio: Paraschiva Dragus was born in 2001. She is an actress, known for The White Ribbon (2009), Operation Sugar (2012) and Amour fou (2014).
biography.name: Paraschiva Dragus

biography.bio: Peter Jordan was born on April 26, 1967 in Dortmund, Germany. He is known for his work on The International (2009), The Runaway (2004) and Soul Kitchen (2009). He is married to Maren Eggert.
biography.name: Peter Jordan

biography.bio: Katharina Schüttler started acting for film and television when she was 11 years old. Her breakthrough in Germany was the International Emmy Award winning Mini-Series "Generation War" ("Unsere Mütter, unsere Väter") in which she portrayed singer Greta del Torres. She appeared in many films for cinema and television, such as Golden Globe winning production "Carlos" by Olivier Assayas, the youngest version of Hans Fallada's "Alone in Berlin" acting alongside Emma Thompson and Swedish Production "Simon and the Oaks" by Lisa Ohlin. She was in German Indie-hits "Oh Boy", "Zeit der Kannibalen" and recently portrayed Fräulein Rottenmeier in the remake of "Heidi" by Alain Gsponer. In "13 Minutes" ("Elser") by Oliver Hirschbiegel ("Der Untergang"), which premiered in the Berlinale Film Festival (out of competition), she performed Hitler assassin Georg Elser's lover Elsa and recently worked with German director Dani Levy in "Die Welt der Wunderlichs".She is best known to English-language audiences for her lead performances in the Channel 4 drama Mini-Series "The Promise" by Peter Kosminsky, alongside Claire Foy and "Run", by Jonathan Pearson, starring Olivia Colman and Katie Leung. In 2009 she received the Bavarian Film Award, the "Guenter Strack Nachwuchspreis" in 2006 and Best Actress at the Munich Film Festival in 2002. For her performance in "Generation War", which won the International Emmy Award, she received the German Television Award as well as the Bavarian TV Award with her co-actors Tom Schilling, Miriam Stein, Ludwig Trepte and Volker Bruch in 2013. In 2014 she was given the Günter-Rohrbach-Filmpreis for her performance in "Zeit der Kannibalen" together with Devid Striesow and Sebastian Blomberg. Besides her film works she is one of the leading young theatre actresses in Germany. In 2006 she received the German Theatre Award "Der Faust" as Best Actress and was voted "Actress of the Year" by the German Theatre Critics. She was the youngest actress ever to receive this honour. In 2010 she was awarded with the renowned "Ulrich Wildgruber Prize" for outstanding artistic performances. In 2009 she won the "Bavarian Film Prize" as Best Young Actress for her performance in the terrorist-drama "The Day Will Come" ("Es kommt der Tag"). Besides her film works she is one of the leading young theatre actresses in Germany. Her works include "Hedda Gabler", "Penthesilea", "Blasted", "Joan of Arc", "Lolita" and many more. She was awarded with the renowned "Ulrich Wildgruber Prize 2010".
biography.name: Katharina Schüttler

biography.bio: Gustav-Peter Wöhler was born on July 31, 1956 in Bielefeld, Germany. He is an actor, known for SK Kölsch (1999), Herman the German (2015) and Illumination garantie (1999). He has been married to Albert Wiederspiel since 2008.
biography.name: Gustav-Peter Wöhler

biography.bio: Marie-Paule von Roesgen is an actress, known for Shadow of the Vampire (2000), Amour fou (2014) and Humains (2009).
biography.name: Marie-Paule von Roesgen

biography.bio: Marc Bischoff was born in 1969 in Berlin, Germany. He is an actor, known for Taxidermie (2006), Good Bye Lenin! (2003) and Enemy at the Gates (2001).
biography.name: Marc Bischoff

biography.bio: Christina Landshamer is an actress, known for Amour fou (2014), Il mondo della luna (2009) and Die Frau ohne Schatten (2011).
biography.name: Christina Landshamer

biography.bio: Gerold Huber is an actor, known for Amour fou (2014).
biography.name: Gerold Huber
